thread.title: Navy took nukes to the Falklands on Prince Andrew's vessel
thread.title_full: Navy took nukes to the Falklands on Prince Andrew's vessel

title: Navy took nukes to the Falklands on Prince Andrew's vessel
text: Share this article Share According to the report, the Royal Navy should have removed the ordnance from the warships before the fleet sailed to the South Atlantic, but the task was not performed since offloading the weapons would have given the Argentinians more time to dig in. The presence of the weapons aboard British ships in the Falklands War was not officially confirmed until 2005. An MoD report that year acknowledged the risks involved but added: ‘The operational imperative to dispatch the task force as rapidly as possible was judged by admirals and Ministers to take precedence over the safety advantages of returning the weapons to a home base.’ Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
